instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Not powering up
threads.message:
Have this board, that appears to be good, just not booting up. When i attempt to revive i get this message, "Configurator could not perform the requested action because the device is not in recovery mode."

When i attempt restore, i get this message, "Can't restore device in this state - please reboot into Recovery or DFU [com.apple.MobileDevice.MobileRestore â€“ 0xFA0 (4000)]"

Every time i restart i end up with the same screen, a lock image and not the DFU image.

Any suggestions on how to get back into DFU mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Not powering up
threads.message:
Something went wrong with T2.
Recently had similar problem.
Usually affected by liquid spill on audio board.
Some T2 data lines are too close to <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, on the flex also.
